result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Greg Rochon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, treatment, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no contact with J.A.R., DOB: 09-07-1980.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 4 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Methamphetamine, possess Fentanyl, disorderly conduct-dvo, battery-dvo, intimidation of witness.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with J.A.R., DOB: 09-07-1980 or any premises they occupy and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
